title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {rpapersurvey: Interact with Data on 'PaperSurvey.io'},   author = {Jake Hughey and Linus Wong},   year = {2023},   note = {https://agency-fund.github.io/rpapersurvey/, https://github.com/agency-fund/rpapersurvey}, }

title: Interact with Data on PaperSurvey.io
text: PaperSurvey.io platform generating printable paper surveys converting completed surveys digital data using image recognition. rpapersurvey R package uses PaperSurvey.io API interact programmatically service. API access currently available customers Enterprise Plus plan.

title: Interact with Data on PaperSurvey.io
text: basic example: details, see reference documentation.
code: library('data.table') library('rpapersurvey')  psio_set_api_key('PATH_TO_API_KEY')  # fetch metadata for all surveys surveys = psio_get_surveys()  # fetch entries for a given survey entries = psio_get_entries(surveys$id[1L])  # extract answers from entries answers = psio_get_answers(entries)

title: Extract answers from entries — psio_get_answers
text: entries come Data API, function returns slightly different information psio_get_reviews(), uses Review API.

title: Extract answers from entries — psio_get_answers
text: entries Result returned psio_get_entries().

title: Extract answers from entries — psio_get_answers
text: list three data.tables one row per entry, per field, per option, respectively.

title: Get the API key — psio_get_api_key
text: function normally called directly, used various functions rpapersurvey package.

title: Get the API key — psio_get_api_key
text: string, invisibly. give error key set.

title: Get documents — psio_get_documents
text: Get documents

title: Get documents — psio_get_documents
text: survey_id Integer survey id. per_page Integer chunk fetching results.

title: Get documents — psio_get_documents
text: data.table one row per document.

title: Get entries — psio_get_entries
text: entry corresponds completed survey.

title: Get entries — psio_get_entries
code: psio_get_entries(   survey_id,   cache_dir = NULL,   per_page = 200L,   max_pages = 5L,   document_id = NULL,   without_images = TRUE,   without_uploads = TRUE,   from = NULL )

title: Get entries — psio_get_entries
text: survey_id Integer survey id. cache_dir Optional string path directory cache results. per_page Integer chunk fetching results. max_pages Integer maximum number pages fetch. NULL indicates pages, .e., results. document_id Optional integer retrieving results specific document. without_images Logical disabling temporary links images, thereby considerably reducing time fetch results. without_uploads Logical disabling information uploads (pages element), thereby marginally reducing time fetch results. Optional integer, interpreted Unix timestamp, retrieving results created updated given date time.

title: Get entries — psio_get_entries
text: list one element per entry.

title: Extract fields from entries — psio_get_fields
text: field corresponds individual question survey, distinguishes results returned function psio_get_questions().

title: Extract fields from entries — psio_get_fields
text: entries Result returned psio_get_entries(). recoding Optional data.frame recoding field names. NULL, must include columns field_id field_name_new.

title: Extract fields from entries — psio_get_fields
text: data.table one row per field.

title: Get questions — psio_get_questions
text: question correspond group single-choice fields, distinguishes results returned function psio_get_fields().

title: Get questions — psio_get_questions
text: survey_id Integer survey id.

title: Get questions — psio_get_questions
text: data.table one row per question.

title: Get answers for review — psio_get_reviews
text: function uses Review API, formats results slightly differently Data API used psio_get_entries() thus psio_get_answers().

title: Get answers for review — psio_get_reviews
code: psio_get_reviews(   survey_id,   cache_dir = NULL,   per_page = 200L,   max_pages = 5L,   sort_by = c("answer_id", "entry_id", "upload_id", "question_id", "verifiable_id",     "quality", "answer", "accepted", "updated_at"),   sort_order = c("DESC", "ASC"),   filters = NULL )

title: Get answers for review — psio_get_reviews
text: survey_id Integer survey id. cache_dir Optional string path directory cache results. per_page Integer chunk fetching results. max_pages Integer maximum number pages fetch. NULL indicates pages, .e., results. sort_by String field sort results. sort_order String order sort results. filters Optional list returning results meeting certain criteria.

title: Get answers for review — psio_get_reviews
text: data.table one row per answer. include prefilled responses responses collected via web form.

text: Get survey metadata

title: Get survey metadata — psio_get_surveys
text: survey_id Optional integer survey id. NULL indicates surveys.

title: Get survey metadata — psio_get_surveys
text: data.table one row per survey.

title: Update an answer to a particular question. — psio_set_answer
Update an answer to a particular question. — psio_set_answer
text: survey_id Integer survey id. answer_id Integer answer id, obtainable psio_get_answers() psio_get_reviews(). answer Value new answer. Depending type question, string, integer, list. dry_run Logical whether dry run real deal.

title: Update an answer to a particular question. — psio_set_answer
text: dry_run TRUE, list returned httr2::req_dry_run(). Otherwise, httr2::response().

title: Set the API key — psio_set_api_key
text: Setting API key necessary fetch data PaperSurvey.io.

title: Set the API key — psio_set_api_key
text: path String path text file containing API key. NULL, secure prompt open enter key.

text: Result call base::Sys.setenv().

title: Mark answers as verified or not verified — psio_set_reviews
text: survey_id Integer survey id. answer_ids Vector integers answer id(s), obtainable psio_get_answers() psio_get_reviews(). status String review status. dry_run Logical whether dry run real deal.

title: Mark answers as verified or not verified — psio_set_reviews
text: dry_run TRUE, list returned httr2::req_dry_run(). Otherwise, httr2::response().
